properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Santa's Sydney Sleigh Ride in the Sydney CBD. Events start from 6.30pm and the Sleigh Ride will start at Customs House Square near Circular Quay at 8.10pm, travel along Pitt St and arrive at Martin Pl at approx. 8.20pm. The sleigh will then leave Martin Pl at 8.35pm, arriving at Town Hall at 8.45pm.

The following road closures will be in place from 5pm to 10.30pm to safely facilitate the event:

  • Pitt St between Hunter St and King St
  • Hunter St between Castlereagh St and Pitt St (westbound)

Managed access to Pitt St car parks will be maintained via contra flow conditions from Hunter St to Martin Pl and from King St to Martin Pl. Vehicles cannot cross Martin Place on Pitt Street.

Traffic in the CBD on approach to Pitt St will be heavy before, during and after the event. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

arrangementElements.html:
Road Closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Roads will be progressively reopened after infrastructure removal and cleaning.

SYDNEY CBD - FROM 5PM TO 10.30PM

  • Hunter St* between Castlereagh St and Pitt St (westbound)
  • Pitt St^ between Hunter St and King St

*Local traffic access only (vehicles making deliveries or accessing Hunter St car parks).

^Managed access to Pitt St car parks (e.g. Angel Pl, Fullerton Hotel car park, Secure car park, Wilson car park, Telstra Broadcast Building car park) will be maintained via contra flow conditions from Hunter St to Martin Pl and from King Street to Martin Place. Vehicles cannot cross Martin Pl on Pitt St.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains, metro and light rail. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
WBBL matches at North Sydney Oval. Match days are Thursday 13 and 20 November, Sunday 30 November and Sunday 7 December.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around North Sydney Oval, especially during weekday peak travel times.

Allow extra time and travel with a group if you have to drive.

Limited street parking is available in the area and Ridge St car park is within walking Distance of the Oval. Fees apply.

arrangementElements.html:
Thursday 13 November at 7:10pm: WBBL: Sydney Sixers v Hobart Hurricanes

Thursday 20 November at 3:40pm: WBBL: Melbourne Renegades v Hobart Hurricanes | Sydney Sixers v Melbourne Stars

Sunday 30 November at 12:10pm: WBBL: Brisbane Heat v Adelaide Strikers | Sydney Sixers v Sydney Thunder

Sunday 7 December at 10:40am: WBBL: Sydney Sixers v Adelaide Strikers
arrangementElements.title: Match dates and times

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
November concert nights on Fleet Steps at Mrs Macquaries Point in the Royal Botanic Garden.

  • Thursday 20 November: Olivia Dean. Starts at 7pm.
  • Friday 21 November: Hot Dub on the Harbour. Starts at 6pm, finishes around 10.30pm.
  • Saturday 22 November: Harbourlife. Starts at 2pm, finishes around 10pm.

ROAD CLOSURES – Thursday 20 to Saturday 22 November

  • From 12.30pm to midnight daily: Mrs Macquaries Road (northern loop)
  • From 8.30pm to 11pm daily: Art Gallery Rd from of Hospital Road and Mrs Macquaries Road

Allow extra time travelling in the area as traffic will be heavier than usual as attendees make their way to and from each show, particularly during the already busy weeknight peak.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Melbourne Victory at Leichhardt Oval. Kick-off 7.35pm, full time around 9.20pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on James St, Perry St, Balmain Rd, Mary St and Glover St as attendees travel to and from the match.

A section of Mary Street may close before the game and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area. Traffic will be detoured via Chapel St while the closure is in place.   

Motorists requiring access to other venues in the area should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Illawarra Hawks v Melbourne United at WIN Entertainment Centre. Tip-off at 7.30pm, full time around 9.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Entertainment Centre as fans travel to the match in the already busy evening peak.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Central Coast Mariners at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, finish around 6.55pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Parramatta Road, Church Street, Victoria Road, James Ruse Drive and Pennant Hills Road. 

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. 

Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.

webLinks.linkText: What's on at ICC Sydney Theatre

properties.publicTransport: L1 light rail services run regularly to stops at Darling Harbour. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Performances at ICC Sydney Theatre:

  • Ronghao Li - Friday 21 November
  • The Imperfects - Saturday 22 November
  • TikTok Awards 2025 - Wednesday 26 November
  • Tim Minchin - Saturday 29 November

﻿Allow extra travel time on roads in the city and Pyrmont around Darling Harbour as traffic may be heavier than usual as attendees travel to the shows, particularly during peak evening periods.

Motorists should exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in place at the following locations to facilitate Sydney Trains trackwork replacement bus operations:

  • Chalmers St, western side, between Cleveland St and Devonshire St, and
  • Chalmers St, eastern side, between Cleveland St and Rutland St.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully, as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Le Jolly Market from Thursday 11 to Sunday 21 December. Weekdays between 4pm and 10.30pm and weekends between 11am and 10.30pm (hours vary).

The Christmas markets are being held at Customs House Forecourt (on Alfred St).

Traffic will be heavy in the area throughout the event. Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.
Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place to assist with entering and exiting of the event.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Festival Stakes Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12.20pm, last race from 5.55pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Hypersonic Festival at Sydney Showground on Saturday from 1pm until 11pm.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Those driving should pre-book online ahead of time to secure a space. If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry. Carpool with your group and allow plenty of extra travel time as traffic will be heavy while other events also take place in the precinct.

Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park. Opal fares apply.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct and traffic congestion is expected before and after the event. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
School Spectacular at Qudos Bank Arena on Friday 28 and Saturday 29 November.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as concert-goers make their way to Olympic Park is the already busy evening peak on Friday. On Saturday a music festival will also be held nearby at Sydney Showground.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Matildas v New Zealand International Friendly at polytec Stadium. Matildas v New Zealand kick off at 4.15pm, Young Matildas v Thailand kick off at 7.35pm, finish approx. 9.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to and from the stadium. Allow extra travel time and use local parking. 

Dane Drive will be closed from 3pm between the Central Coast Highway and Donnison Street and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on transport. Buses will divert while roads are closed after the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Sydney FC at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 7.35pm, finish around 9.30pm.

With up to 30,000 fans expected at the Sydney Derby clash, traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Parramatta and nearby car parks are expected to be in high demand.

Allow extra travel time on roads including Parramatta Road, Church Street, Victoria Road, James Ruse Drive and Pennant Hills Road. 

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. 

Drivers are reminded that light rail services are running through Parramatta CBD. Trams can’t stop quickly or easily – so exercise extra caution when driving in the area. 

Road closures 

Roads around the stadium will close from 9.30pm to 10pm approx. to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell Street from Grose Street to George Street 
  • Ross Street from O’Connell Street to Trott Street 
  • Victoria Road from O’Connell Street to Villiers Street 

While closures are in place motorists are encouraged to avoid driving through Parramatta CBD and detour around the closures via Grose Street, Brickfield Street, Victoria Road and Wilde Avenue in both directions.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Perth Glory at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off at 6pm, full time around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Melbourne City at polytec Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, full-time around 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to and from the stadium. Allow extra travel time and use local parking. 

Dane Drive will be closed before the match from 3pm between the Central Coast Highway and Donnison Street and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip by transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
DFO 'Black Friday Sales' Weekend. DFO will extend operating hours on Friday 28 November from 8am - 8pm and Saturday 29/Sunday 30 November from 9am - 7pm.

Traffic delays are expected as shoppers make their way to the centre, particularly during the already busy Friday evening peak.

On Saturday and Sunday events will also be held at venues in nearby Sydney Olympic Park adding to expected traffic congestion in and around the precinct.

Motorists should allow extra plenty of extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Underwood Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd and Centenary Dr.

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AC/DC concerts at Accor Stadium on Friday 21 and Tuesday 25 November. Gates open from 5pm, concert finishes around 10.45pm each night.

With around 75,000 concert-goers expected at each show, significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct. The roads will be particularly busy on Friday with 15,000 fans also attending a concert at Qudos Bank Arena next door.  

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • PARKING UPDATE: All available pre-booked parking spaces in Olympic Park are SOLD OUT for Friday 21 November and selling fast for Tuesday 25 November. If you need to drive it is essential that you pre-book parking online, an event flat rate $35 parking fee will apply.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Carpool with your group and allow plenty of extra travel time. Significant traffic delays are expected, especially on Friday during the busy evening peak.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event and to accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on transport. Light rail and buses run regularly to Moore Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sam Fender at The Entertainment Quarter. Show starts at 6.30pm, finish around 9.50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as thousands of attendees travel to the show is the already busy evening peak.

Driver Avenue will be closed between John Hargreaves Avenue and Lang Road from 8pm to midnight.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Albion St and Lang Road, and from 6am to 11pm on Cleveland St and Fitzroy St

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Albion Street and Lang Road, and from 6am to 11pm on Cleveland Street and Fitzroy Street.  

From 3pm to 11pm 

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides) 
  • Lang Road between Anzac Parade and Errol Flynn Boulevard (northern side)   

From 6am to 11pm 

  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (southern side) 
  • Cleveland Street between Abercrombie Street and South Dowling Street (northern side) 
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side) 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Route 304 and 352 buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for City of Sydney's Surry Hills Christmas Fair event along Crown Street on Saturday 13 December. The event runs from 2:30pm until 10pm.

  • Crown St will be closed in both directions between Cleveland St and Foveaux St from 7am until 11:30pm
  • Sections of Arthur St, Collins St, Collins Ln, Davies St, Devonshire St, Jesson Ln, Jesson St, High Holborn St, Landsowne St, Miles St, Rainford St, Richards Ln and Withers Ln will also be closed.
  • Motorists travelling from the south towards the city should detour via Cleveland St, Elizabeth St and Albion St.
  • Motorists travelling from the north should detour via Foveaux St, Elizabeth St and Cleveland St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am until 11:30pm on sections of Crown St, Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Landsdowne St, Rainford St and Withers Ln.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:

If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice: The Orange City Centre Santa Claus Parade will take place on Saturday 30 Nov from 10am to 12pm. The Mitchell Hwy will be closed between Anson Street and Lords Place.
properties.diversions:
Light vehicles - Lords Pl, Kite St or Byng St, Anson St

Heavy vehicles via the Northern Distributor
properties.displayName: Orange City Centre Santa Claus Parade

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Camden Christmas Festival from 4pm to 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Camden Town Centre while roads are closed for the event.

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Road closures from 10am to 11.30pm

  • Argyle St between Murray St and Elizabeth St
  • John St between Broughton St and Mitchell St
  • Oxley St between Argyle and Mitchell St
  • Hill St between Broughton St
  • Larking Pl stopping vehicles from exiting onto John St
  • Camden War Memorial Pool parking (bus access only)
Increased traffic may be experienced around the Newcastle Entertainment Centre precinct.

The Moruya Campdraft will be held over three days with a there will be a speed reduction of 60 km/h in place on the Princes Highway at the event site, and alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place if required.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Multiple events are taking place this weekend.

  • Thursday 20, Friday 21 and Saturday 22 November: RÜFÜS DU SOL concerts from 7pm, finishing around 10.45pm nightly. 
  • Friday 21 November – 70,000 AC/DC fans at Accor Stadium from 5pm.
  • Saturday 22 November – Tardezinha 10 years at Cathy Freeman Park from 2pm and LG Fest at Sydney Showground from 5pm to 11pm.

Traffic will be heavy approaching Olympic Park on concert nights, particularly during weeknight peak travel times and while other events are on in the precinct. Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

  • PARKING UPDATE: All available pre-booked parking spaces in Olympic Park are SOLD OUT for Friday 21 November, remaining concert dates are selling fast. If you need to drive it is essential that you pre-book parking online, an event flat rate $35 parking fee will apply.
  • To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during the event. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road
